title: Tourism Australia’s ‘supersized selfie’
text:
Tourism Australia offers tourists the chance to take a 'supersized selfie'. Courtesy Tourism Australia. News Corp Australia 03 Sep 2015 Lifestyle Travel 
TOURISM Australia is giving Japanese travellers the opportunity to get involved in a “supersized selfie” this weekend as part of its “There’s nothing like Australia” campaign. 
Launching on the Gold Coast this Saturday, the “GIGA Selfie” event is part of Tourism Australia’s efforts to promote Australia to a younger and social media savvy Japanese consumer. 
To take their enormous selfie, travellers stand on a designated spot and use the “GIGA Selfie” app on their smartphone to trigger a camera mounted in the distance, which captures their photo. 
The selfie starts as a close up and then pulls back in a short video clip to reveal their location. A link is emailed to them for sharing. 
Japan is a key market for Tourism Australia with more than 320,000 Japanese visitors travelling here in the past year alone, contributing more than $1.4 billion in visitor spend. 
The Gold Coast is one of the most popular and visited destinations among the Japanese in Australia, with emphasis being placed on Australia’s aquatic coastal experiences. The selfie will take in the surrounding landscape of the Gold Coast. Picture: Tourism Australia. Source: YouTube 
“With new air services coming online this year there is a real opportunity to further grow travel from Japan and capture the renewed interest in Australia as a travel destination. 
“The ‘GIGA Selfie’ campaign will help to raise the level of conversation about Australia in Japan as people share their incredible experiences of holidaying here with their friends and family back home, and inturn helping to encourage more Japanese travellers to follow in their footsteps,” Mr O’Sullivan said. 
The campaign is being promoted across a wide range of channels in Japan including digital media, TV, newspapers and travel agencies. Dates and locations for future “GIGA Selfie” events will be confirmed through the campaign website . 
The event kicks off on the Gold Coast from 11am to 4pm on Saturday 5 and Sunday 6 September.
